lender.occupational_info: I take portraits of school-aged children and families.

lender.name: Melissa
lender.loan_because: My mom started with Kiva a while back and got the rest of us started. I think this is a great idea.

lender.name: Tarun

lender.occupational_info: I am a student at Rutgers University and I am currently in pursuit of getting an Engineering Degree.

lender.name: Jean-Francois
lender.loan_because: it's an easy way to help someone live better.

lender.name: Laurie

lender.occupational_info: I spend most of my time playing. I like to knock over towers of blocks and sing.

lender.name: Bernie
lender.loan_because: I can.
lender.occupational_info: I make things work.

lender.name: Osage School 3-Pitel
lender.loan_because: we are learning about how people of the world live by using their natural resources. Some areas have more resources than others. We want to help give someone without a lot of resources a chance in life. We want to grow up to make a difference in the world so we have saved our snack money in a Kiva piggy bank so we could help.
lender.occupational_info: We are typical 8 and 9 year olds who live in Voorhees, New Jersey, USA. People from all over the world attend our school and everybody is like one big family. We love recess and snow days!

lender.name: Erin and Evan
lender.loan_because: this was a christmas gift from our auntie!
lender.occupational_info: We focus on climate justice and supporting land struggles, along with anti-discrimination / anti-oppression work in our community.

lender.name: Patricia
lender.loan_because: As I always tried to teach my children, yes there are people who have more than us, but there are also those you have far less.
lender.occupational_info: I work for a commercial real estate company. I answer all calls and do secretarial computer work.

lender.name: Jeremy
lender.loan_because: I was given a start-up account in Kiva as a gift. I am currently making my first loans on Kiva and I hope to continue the cycle when they are repaid. I believe that in today's broken economy, direct lending to those in need is the most basic, straightforward, and honest way to help.
lender.occupational_info: I work for a global shipping/transportation company. I also help run a non-profit that teaches and promotes safety in the practice of Parkour.

lender.name: Clare
lender.loan_because: the American dream should be attainable no matter where you live.

lender.name: Blair
lender.loan_because: It matters.
lender.occupational_info: I work for a non-profit contractor for USAID.

lender.name: Steve, Hilee & Cati
lender.occupation: railroad station agent, dog training, student
lender.loan_because: to improve the lives of others
lender.occupational_info: Husband is a railroad station agent, wife is involved with training service dogs and a homemaker, and Cati is a student.

lender.name: Benjamin
lender.loan_because: I care about the world, and I want to help as many people as possible. I think this is a great way to give people opportunities to develop local economies. I sincerely hope that these opportunities create jobs, improve education, and advance medical care.
lender.occupational_info: I write computer software for the financial markets.

lender.name: DeWayne
lender.loan_because: We should strive to leave the world better than we found it ... this is one of the ways I am trying to accomplish that.
lender.occupational_info: I am a data management coordinator at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.

lender.name: Cornflake11
lender.loan_because: If I was a new buisness owner, I would appreciate as much help as possible

lender.name: Wilsonian
lender.occupation: Takin care of Linden, Learning & Enjoying Life
lender.loan_because: It works.

lender.name: Dick and Marylyn
lender.loan_because: We believe in encouraging people to better their own lives and those of their friends and family.
lender.occupational_info: We are a retired Federal civil service family.

lender.name: Joshua
lender.loan_because: I realize that I am privileged as a white male from the United States coming from a middle-upper class background, and that every human from any background has the same basic requirements (food, shelter, clean water, access to health care and education, etc.), and as such, those of us who come from a privileged background have a moral responsibility to show solidarity with their fellow human beings who don't have access to those basic human requirements.
lender.occupational_info: I'm a student at Pacific Lutheran University. I am double-majoring in Hispanic Studies and Environmental Studies. After college, I hope to work abroad for a few years, perhaps interning on a permaculture farm in Mexico or somewhere in Latin America, working for the Peace Corps, working for an NGO or Non-Profit organization internationally, and/or going to graduate school.

lender.name: Marco & Tammy
lender.loan_because: A relative got me started and it feels good to help others.

lender.name: Peri
lender.loan_because: people from developing countries should have the opportunity to better their situations and lives.
lender.occupational_info: I am home with my three children and care for them on a daily basis.

lender.name: David
lender.loan_because: I believe we all share this world together, and must always help each other
lender.occupational_info: I am a professional singer of opera and classical music - I'm from the US, but currently live in Germany

lender.name: David and Cate
lender.loan_because: I want to help others

lender.name: Isaac
lender.loan_because:
I loan because the people that I loan to have kids and kids must learn at school to have a job later.
And I loan to some people that don't have kids, because they need it, too.
lender.occupational_info: I go to grade one.

lender.name: Andreas
lender.loan_because:
When I joined, I thought Kiva was the best place and had the best mechanism to fight poverty.
Following Kiva's decision to offer loans to USA/developed country entrepreneurs and seeing some of the loans on offer, I am not so sure any more...
I am now slowly withdrawing my funds from Kiva...
What a pity!!!

lender.name: Bjorg
lender.loan_because: I got a gift certificate for Christmas

lender.name: Dalidalo
lender.loan_because: I can
lender.occupational_info: I design the housings and enclosures of measurement instruments- these can detect which substances there are in a liquid or a solid sample. These instruments are used for example to measure water quality or analyse drugs.

lender.name: Susan
lender.loan_because: I am happy to support those who seek to improve the conditions of their life
lender.occupational_info: write historical articles, working on a book of poems

lender.name: Peggy

lender.occupational_info: I do the bookwork, including entry of sales, banking, entries of contracted jobs, mix paint and redecorate in the gift shop

lender.occupational_info: I live in Bangkok Thailand, and my primary job is with a Thai cafe chain, expanding internationally through franchising. We work with local entrepreneurs in each country to bring our Thai food and coffee concept to them. Because my work involves a lot of travel, I also work as a travel writer.

lender.occupational_info: making photographs of all sorts of topics, including the troubles in israel and palestine, especially gaza

lender.name: Mary
lender.loan_because:
It's the right thing to do.
Many of us live a life of privilege in the United States. I have been fortunate to travel around the world and to be embraced, and humbled by the hospitality and kindness of those who have so much less in terms of material wealth and so much more to teach us about love towards each other, and the contributions we can make to our communities, family and friends.
lender.occupational_info:
I am an educator.
I teach adults and I strive to create systems and spaces in organizations where individuals may rediscover their talents, their strengths and their ability to contribute collectively to higher education and to the common good.

lender.name: Roch
lender.loan_because: To try and make a small difference to someone less fortunate than I.

lender.name: Chris

lender.occupational_info: I help make it possible for people to live a healthy life through Public Health programs.

lender.loan_because: I want to empower people to help themselves.
lender.occupational_info: study to become psychotherapist

lender.name: Luana

lender.name: Johnny

lender.name: ossey joel alex
lender.loan_because: create my own business
lender.occupational_info:
Name, Address YAPO Ossey Joel Alex 14 BP 2026 ABIDJAN 14 ABIDJAN COTE D'IVOIRE 00225. osseyalex@yahoo.fr
Subject: Loan Request
Dear
For some months now that I work on the project to create my own business. The project I am particularly interested in heart since I am convinced of its success. Indeed, I intend to start a transport company. I intend to have a fleet of three cars to transport individuals in Abidjan. Indeed Abidjan road is quite dense.Cependant it is insufficient for the transportation of individuals who move each day in Abidjan. Abidjan Car has just over 4 million. At the same transport company I intend to join an Internet cafe a qinzaine posts (computer). But today, I do not yet have all the money needed to finance my project to create activity. To complete your knowledge of this project, I enclose a cash flow forecast. Each car will yield 30 000 CFAF per day. is 90 by 000 CFAF for 3 cars. What makes the euro around 130 euros per day. After a taxi me reports 3 900 euros per me. The charge and operating expenses for the 3 taxi stand at EUR 1 300 by me. Is 2600 euro gain from the operation of 3 taxis. This gives a gain of about 30 000 euro.
cybercaf√© also bring CFAF 30 000 per day. which is equivalent to 900 000 CFAF by me. about 1 500 euro per me. the operating costs of the cafe will be 500 euros per me. cybercaf√© bring 1 000 euro per me. an increase of 12 000 euro
By combining the earnings of taxis and the cafe we have a monthly gain of about 3 600 euros. Which give approximately 42 000 euro prize. I need to launch my business: 18 000 euro for taxis 10 000 euro for the cafe. Either I need a total of 28 000 to start my business. The fact is that I can run separately.
Also I would like to publish this loan application in the hope that can have one or more who agree to participate in the launch of my business. I need financial assistance. Naturally, I am willing to pay an interest by the amount that you agree to m'avance. In order to do things in a transparent, it goes without saying that I am ready to send you an acknowledgment of debt in order to specify the dates and terms of repayment of any amount that you agree to lend me. Of course, I ask you to receive my most distinguished salutations. In anticipation of your positive response, and renewing my thanks,

lender.occupational_info: I was a radiation therapist for over 30 years. Heart disease caused me to stop working. Kiva, allows me to work in another way.

lender.name: Mikko S

Jesus said: "Whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me."
You are my brothers and sisters. How can I refuse you if I see your need?
lender.occupational_info: Being an project manager/lead is not rocket science. It is mostly keeping sure that everyone knows what they should be doing and that the goal we are working toward is clear. My work revolves around technology and I am always trying to find better and smarter ways of utilizing it. IT (information technology) offers many possibilities and it can have an positive effect on our lives when properly used.

lender.name: Diane

lender.occupational_info: I teach children ages 7-9 mostly and work with others up to age 20. I live in a rural Yup'ik Eskimo village, with ~700 residents, in Southwest Alaska. I've been in that area for 8 1/2 years now.

My family and friends have been supportive of me and helped me develop into a strong individual. Hence, I'd like to return the favor. I love the rewarding feeling of helping others improve their lives.
lender.occupational_info: I have recently graduated from Stanford with a degree in Human Biology, a mix of psychology, anthropology, and biology. I am currently applying to medical school, while working as a research assistant in the Center for Health Policy and the Center for Primary Care and Outcomes Research at Stanford University. My work focuses mostly on international child health and includes traveling to Guatemala frequently.
